page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: 1.WALKHAMPTON-HOW OLD ARE THE CARS? There were forty modern{cars}(after 1975),thirty cars between 1965 and 1975 and seven older cars;before 1965. Many{commercial}vehicles are used.We saw some old cars being renovated. The tar roads are narrow with no markings.There are also few caravans around.Most of the drives are made of gravel and stone.The streets are very {clean}and there is scarcely any litter. There is a{minibus}service which is called "The Dartmoor Pony" and runs every hour to Walkhampton. This local service connects the local villages with the Western National main bus services at Yelverton. This service is more convenient than a double decker service based on Plymouth. You need one{ticket}to use both buses.
